H0.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Plimsoll Mark

H1.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Waterline

H2.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Draft Line

H3.text: What is the line called on a ship which is the limit to which it may be loaded. Load-Line

A4.text: Load line (watercraft), related to ship construction

A5.text: Load line (electronics), a method of determining operating points in circuits with non-linear elements

A6.text: The load line, also known as Plimsoll line, indicates the legal limit to which a ship may be loaded

A7.text: The purpose of a load line is to ensure that a ship has sufficient freeboard (the height from the waterline to the main deck) and thus sufficient reserve buoyancy
